The distance by the line from New Orleans would be to the Lafourche 51 miles, to Berwick's Bay 82, to New Iberia 127, Lafayette 145, Opelousas 167, and to Washington 173 miles. From
New Iberia, the branch to Breaux Bridge starts off; this will run
across or near the South point of Lake Tasse, and pass through or
near St. Martinsville, the length of it will be about 18 miles.
The whole line, as far as Washington, will be ready for contract
on or about the 1st of March.
The line located is a remarkably favorable one, (he grades are
very light, (for the most part, perfectly level) the maximum being
but 16 feet per mile. The curvature too is so slight as practically,
to amount to nothing. From New Orleans to Washington, the distance 173 miles, is but 9 per cent over an air line 159 miles. To
■ Berwick's Bay the total number of degrees of curvature amounts to
but 674 degrees.
